meanings.definition: A person who is new to a profession or activity.
meanings.sent1: The rookies on the team were eager to learn and improve.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a group of rookies to bring fresh ideas to the project.
meanings.sent3: The rookies at the cooking class accidentally used salt instead of sugar in the cake.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, rookies are like seeds waiting to grow into strong trees.
meanings.sent5: The rookies in the orchestra played with enthusiasm and passion, despite their lack of experience.

meanings.sent1: The team consisted of mostly rookies who needed guidance from the coach.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a rookie driver as she nervously gripped the steering wheel.
meanings.sent3: The rookie hiker got lost in the woods but managed to find his way back before dark.
meanings.sent4: Being a rookie in the art of painting, she experimented with different techniques to find her style.
meanings.sent5: The rookie chef burned the dish, but it was all part of the learning process in the kitchen.
